verses.verse: Do you indeed<WH552> speak<WH1696> righteousness<WH6664>, O congregation<WH482>? do you judge<WH8199> uprightly<WH4339>, O you sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>?
Yes<WH3820>, in heart you work<WH6466> wickedness<WH5766>; you weigh<WH6424> the violence<WH2555> of your hands<WH3027> in the earth<WH776>.
The wicked<WH7563> are estranged<WH2114> from the womb<WH7358>: they go astray<WH8582> as soon as they are born<WH990>, speaking<WH1696> lies<WH3577>.
Their poison<WH2534> is like<WH1823> the poison<WH2534> of a serpent<WH5175>: they are like the deaf<WH2795> adder<WH6620> that stops<WH331> her ears<WH241>;
Which will not listen<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of charmers<WH3907>, charming<WH2266> never so wisely<WH2449>.
Break<WH2040> their teeth<WH8127>, O God<WH430>, in their mouth<WH6310>: break out<WH5422> the great teeth<WH4459> of the young lions<WH3715>, O Lord<WH3068>.
Let them melt away<WH3988> as waters<WH4325> which run continually<WH1980>: when he bends<WH1869> his bow to shoot his arrows<WH2671>, let them be as cut in pieces<WH4135>.
As a snail<WH7642> which melts<WH8557>, let every one of them pass away<WH1980>: like the untimely birth<WH5309> of a woman<WH802>, that they may not see<WH2372> the sun<WH8121>.
Before your pots<WH5518> can feel<WH995> the thorns<WH329>, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind<WH8175>, both living<WH2416>, and in his wrath<WH2740>.
The righteous<WH6662> shall rejoice<WH8055> when he sees<WH2372> the vengeance<WH5359>: he shall wash<WH7364> his feet<WH6471> in the blood<WH1818> of the wicked<WH7563>.
So that a man<WH120> shall say<WH559>, Truly there is a reward<WH6529> for the righteous<WH6662>: truly he is<WH3426> a God<WH430> that judges<WH8199> in the earth<WH776>.
